The system will re-register your face information.

Please note that Gorilla Technology Group Inc. (hereinafter referred to as “the Company”) will collect, process and use your personal information in accordance with Paragraph 1, Article 8 of the Personal Information Protection Act. If you click the option of “Agree”, it shall be deemed that you have reviewed, understand, and agree to the following:


I. The purpose of collecting personal information

 The Company may collect, process, and use your personal information for security management for entrance and exit or for software demonstration and other legitimate purposes. According to the classification of the Ministry of Justice in “The Specific Purpose and the Classification of Personal Information of the Personal Information Protection Act”, the Company may collect your personal information for purposes of “site safety management” (116).


II. Categories of Personal Information

 Your personal information to be collected by the Company will include your name in Chinese and English, ID card number, telephone, email, face image, and personal identification document. According to the classification of “The Specific Purpose and the Classification of Personal Information of the Personal Information Protection Act” of the Ministry of Justice, the Company collects your personal information for purposes of “personal identification” (C001).


III. The duration, region, target, and means of using personal information


(I) Duration: your personal information will be used by the Company with immediate effect to the second anniversary of the last day of admission to the office, trade show or worksite. You agree that at the expiration of the use of your personal information, the Company may stop processing or using your personal information in lieu of removing or deleting it.


(II) Region: The Company will use your personal information within the Republic of China, the location of the server where personal information is stored, the place of the Company or the subsidiaries and affiliates.


(III) Targets: The Company may transmit your personal information to the subsidiaries and affiliates of the Company or server service providers or any third parties responsible for the processing and use of your personal information under the appointment and direction of the Company.


(IV) Means: Automated machinery or other non-automated means in compliance with the Personal Protection Act and other applicable laws.


IV. Supply of personal information:

 (I) You shall provide accurate, updated, and complete personal information. In the event of changes in your personal information, you shall request for a corresponding change with the Company voluntarily to ensure your personal information accurate, updated, and completed.


(II) If the personal information you provided is erroneous, untrue, outdated, or incomplete or even misleading, your rights and privileges may be jeopardized and you shall be responsible for the consequences thereof.


(III) You may exercise your rights with regard your personal information under the “Personal Information Protection Act” to:


1. Request for inquiry, viewing, or reproduction of your personal information but a fee may be applied by the Company for the service rendered.


2. Request for supplement or correction if provided with the appropriate explanations.


3. Request us to stop collecting, processing and using, or for a removal of your personal information. The Company may turn down your request if your personal information is necessary for the performance of duties by the Company or as dictated by business needs.


V. The effect on your rights and privileges for not providing your personal information


You may choose not to provide your personal information and you shall understand if you so choose, the Company may reject your admission to the office or worksite. Thanks for your time and we regret any inconvenience caused.
